Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission settled charges against BlackRock Institutional Trust Company NA for engaging in prearranged trades that were noncompetitively executed and fictitious sales.

The Securities and Exchange Commission charged BlackRock Advisors LLC with breaching its fiduciary duty by failing to disclose a conflict of interest created by the outside business activity of a top-performing portfolio manager.

The SEC announced sanctions in a continuing enforcement initiative uncovering certain hedge fund advisers and private equity firms that have illegally participated in an offering of a stock after short selling it during a restricted period.
BlackRock agreed to pay over $9 million to settle an ERISA class action accusing it of charging workers and retirees millions in unreasonable 401(k) fees.
Private Litigation Case Title: Baird v. BlackRock Institutional Trust Company, N.A. et al
